intro: Saxifraga stellaris subsp. alpigena, commonly known as the alpine starwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to alpine regions of Europe. It typically reaches heights of 10–20 cm and features dense, rosette-like foliage composed of ovate to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink, often arranged in clusters at the tips of its stems. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Saxifraga stellaris subsp. alpigena is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in alpine ecosystems.
